questions.question: Why was baby Moses put into the Nile River?

choices.answer: Egyptians put him there to kill him like all Jewish babies.
His mother couldn't hide him at home any longer.
His mother left him there by accident after she had a swim.
His mother knew Pharaoh's daughter would find and adopt him.

questions.question: Why did Moses run away from Egypt?

choices.answer: He killed a man for mistreating Jewish slaves
He was afraid others would find out his Jewish heritage.
Pharaoh wanted to kill him because he killed an Egyptian.
He wanted to elope with his girlfriend.

questions.question: Why did Moses come back to Egypt?

choices.answer: He upset his father-in-law, Jethro, so he went home to Egypt
He went back to attend the funeral of his father.
God appeared in a burning bush and told him to save the Jews
There was a famine in the land so he went to Egypt for food.

questions.question: Why did Pharaoh not allow the Israelites to leave Egypt?

choices.answer: He needed the slaves to defend his kingdom.
Because God hardened his heart.
Because he wasn't convinced by Moses' miracles or plagues.
He was too proud to give in to Moses' request.

questions.question: What had to die in order to save the first-born from the final plague?

choices.answer: A bull
A ram
Jesus
A lamb or kid (young goat)

questions.question: How were the Israelites saved?

choices.answer: They left in secret and covered their tracks
They armed themselves so the Egyptians didn't oppose them.
God covered them in a cloud so the Egyptians couldn't follow
They walked through the water which God parted for them.

questions.question: Why did Moses lead the Israelites to Mt. Sinai?

choices.answer: To show them his new home.
It was on the way to the Promised Land
So they could meet with God.
He got lost

questions.question: What was the point of the Tabernacle?

choices.answer: It housed the Ark of the Covenant, God's agreement with Jews
It served as Moses special tent where he would meet visitors
It reminded the Israelites of the Garden of Eden.
It gave access to God's presence, his mercy and forgiveness.

questions.question: Why could Moses not enter the Tabernacle?

choices.answer: Because sinful people can't stand before a holy God.
There was no door into the Tabernacle
He was not from the house of Levi, so could not be a priest.
He died before it was completed.

questions.question: Why were the Israelites in the wilderness for 40 years?

choices.answer: They didn't know the way
Because they were following a cloud.
God had to prepare a new generation to learn to trust him.
It actually takes that long to walk from Egypt to Palestine

questions.question: How did they survive during their time in the wilderness?

choices.answer: They stole from various settlements
God gave bread, water from springs and animals for meat.
They resorted to cannibalism
Pepe's Palestinian Pizza deliveries.

questions.question: Why was God giving the Israelites the Promised Land?

choices.answer: Because they deserved it
Because it was the most fertile land around.
Because of the promise God made to their ancestor Abraham.
Because it was originally theirs before others invaded it.

questions.question: Which of these did the Israelites do right when they entered the Promised Land?

choices.answer: They conquered all of the Canaanite tribes in the land.
They remove and destroy all the idols of other gods.
They are circumcised and commemorate the Passover.
They continue to rely on God, read and follow his laws.

questions.question: Who were the Judges?

choices.answer: Elders who ruled over one of the 12 tribes of Israel.
Leaders God raised up to save Israel if they cried for help
Military commanders from other tribes who attacked Israel.
People who sat in courts and decided over right and wrong.

questions.question: Why wasn't Israel supposed to have a king?

choices.answer: Because God was supposed to be their king.
So they would be different from other tribes.
So they would not need to build a capital or a palace.
Because nobody was good enough to rule them.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT true for the prophet Samuel?

choices.answer: He was a boy when God first talked to him in the Tabernacle.
He counts as the last and greatest of the judges of Israel.
He chose both King Saul and King David
He raised great sons who followed in his footsteps.

questions.question: Who were the prophets?

choices.answer: People who advised kings, speaking on God's behalf
People who wrote books about Israel's past
People who ran the Tabernacle
People who prophesied what would happen in Israel's future.

questions.question: What was promised to King David for his faithfulness to God?

choices.answer: That one of his descendants would rule forever.
That his songs would still be sung over 2000 years later.
That he would get to build a temple for God
That his family would live in peace.

questions.question: What was the result of David's sin with Bathsheba and his cover-up by killing Uriah?

choices.answer: David lost his throne
David and Bathsheba's child died
David's sons followed his example and acted treacherously
David had a nice warm bath.

questions.question: Which of these did NOT happened to Israel after David's son Solomon takes the throne?

choices.answer: Israel splits into the Northern and the Southern Kingdom
They all live happily ever after.
Solomon and successors act as bad as Pharaoh was in Egypt
Israel is conquered, Temple destroyed, survivors are exiled
